title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Bigode Branco White (Lisboa)
description: The smooth flavors of Fernão Pires make this wine. They give a ripe character of whisked cream and apples. The wine is totally ready to drink.

title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Coreto Branco White (Lisboa)
description: The wine is crisp and as light as a feather. The fruitiness brings with it apple and pink grapefruit as well as warmer golden plums and a perfumed aftertaste. Drink the wine now.

title: Château de Belcier 2016 Fleurs de Belcier Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This wine has a ripe texture, rich fruit and touches of spice. Full bodied and tangy, it's smooth, with a hint of caramel. Drink now.

title: Château de Lisennes 2016 7 Hectares Vin Bio Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This wine has a caramel edge that gives richness but also detracts from the fruit. It offers a smooth texture along with a spicy edge. Drink now.

title: Château des Arnauds 2016 Les Caprices d'Anaïs Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This vivid pink-colored wine, 50-50 Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, is soft, with gentle fruitiness and crisp edge. Acidity and a herbal edge add a more textured character. Drink now.

title: Enoport 2016 Mapreco Rosé (Vinho Verde)
description: This wine is on the sweet side of crisp, with ripe strawberry and plenty of acidity. It is a wine to chill, with its bright aftertaste and slight prickle on the tongue. Drink now.

title: Marques de Toledo 2015 Verdejo (La Mancha)
description: This wine's neutral nose includes mild citrus scents. It's tired and bland on the palate, with yeasty flavors, finishing with papaya and commercial white bread notes.

title: Ostras Pedrin 2016 Verdosilla (Valencia)
description: In this Verdosilla, an obscure white variety from the Valencia region, yeasty, bready aromas are mild and slightly floral. Its palate is watery and not very crisp, with dry apricot flavors that have no zing.

title: Portal del Montsant 2015 Brunus Rosé (Montsant)
description: This flat, watery wine has yeasty, generic stone fruit flavors and salty, bitter grape skin flavors. It's round in mouthfeel but inexact on the finish.

title: Vicente Gandia 2016 Finca del Mar Chardonnay Chardonnay (Valencia)
description: A tan color and dusty, tired aromas put this Chardonnay on short notice. Its plump palate delivers a mix of stone fruit and bitter, skin-based flavors, with a static finish.

title: Viña San Juan 2015 White (La Mancha)
description: This blend of Chardonnay, Viura and Verdejo is light in body, with stalky haystack aromas and dilute nectarine and melon flavors. Its yeasty finish is somewhat bland.

title: Vinihold 2016 Altimo Branco White (Dão)
description: The Encruzado and Malvasia blend is both fruity and intensely perfumed. It has a touch of lychee as well as crisper grapefruit. Drink the wine starting now.

title: Santa Carolina 2016 Reserva Chardonnay (Leyda Valley)
description: Bland apple and citrus aromas are oaky, with a note of popcorn. This feels plump and short on core acidity. Melon, applesauce and oak-resin flavors finish flat and with a flavor note of fresh butter.

title: Santi 2016 Infinito  (Bardolino Chiaretto)
description: Aromas of orange blossom and wild berry lead the way. The bright simple palate is on the slender side, offering suggestions of strawberry and cherry alongside vibrant acidity.

title: Santos & Santos 2013 Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte Reserva Red (Alentejano)
description: There is plenty of juicy acidity in this wine even though the fruit has a strangely steely character. The tannins give it a firm character that needs to soften.
designation: Herdade da Fonte Coberta Ouro do Monte Reserva

title: Stone Castle 2014 Amphora Red (Rahoveci Valley)
description: This blend of Gamay and Prokupe has aromas of tart cherry and Mediterranean herbs. Flavors recall cherry, black plum and stewed prune.

title: Stone Castle 2015 Royal Riesling (Rahoveci Valley)
description: This wine has aromas of honeysuckle and lemon curd, with flavors of lemon-meringue pie and lemon pith. The finish is clean and crisp.

title: Las Niñas 2015 Reserva Chardonnay (Apalta)
description: Applesauce and woody aromas don't offend but they aren't anything special or enticing. This feels chunky and fairly flat. Woody resiny flavors are low to empty on fruit, while this tastes yeasty on the finish.

title: TerraNoble 2013 Gran Reserva Carmenère (Maule Valley)
description: Charred resiny oak aromas dominate herbal berry fruit. This is rough and raw on the palate, with sizzling tartaric acidity and forceful tannins. Flavors of burnt black coffee and herbal plum finish with a ring of excess acidity.

title: Côtnar Hills 2014 Semi-Dry Rosé (Ukraine)
description: This medium-bodied rosé has aromas of strawberries and rose petals, and flavors of cherry, strawberry and tart cherry. The finish is clean, with a slight touch of residual sweetness on the palate.

title: Cantine Ermes 2016 Marchese Montefusco Rosato (Terre Siciliane)
description: This simple rosato has subdued aromas suggesting red berry and a whiff of wild flower. The light informal palate evokes sour cherry and orange zest alongside tangy acidity.

title: Cellers Unió 2015 Perlat Red (Montsant)
description: This Garnacha-Carignan blend contains some Syrah as well and smells almost exclusively of clove and spice. On the palate, it's resiny and sticky, with overwrought clove and barrel spice flavors that dominate the finish.

title: Château Haut Mondain 2016  Bordeaux Blanc
description: A light and bright wine, this offers plenty of herbal fruit that is lifted by crisp acidity. The wine is refreshing, lively and ready to drink.

title: Château Lamothe-Vincent 2016 Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
description: This candy-pink-colored wine offers candy-pink-colored flavors. It conveys caramel as much as fruit, although with acidity and a tangy aftertaste.

title: Adega Cooperativa de Borba 2016 Cuvée B Rosé (Alentejo)
description: There is no compromise in the pinkness of the color of this wine. It is fruity with plenty of acidity and with a touch of caramel as well as some light tannins. Drink this blend of Syrah and Aragonez now.

title: Santa Ema 2015 Reserva Merlot (Maipo Valley)
description: Heavy oak aromas of marshmallow, vanilla and clove are forced and candied. This has a dense blocky feel, while pounding flavors of clove and chocolate dominate.

title: Enoport 2016 Mapreco White (Vinho Verde)
description: Apples and limes lend their crispness to this otherwise bland wine. It is sweet with light fruitiness and a bright acidity. Drink now.

title: Alta Alella 2016 Privat PB Organic Pansa Blanca (Alella)
description: This Xarello feels juicy and acidic but ultimately lean and simple. Its grassy aromas include a whiff of hay and a touch of mango while its generic citrus and tropical flavors finish with acidic pop.

title: Vega Tolosa 2015 11 Pinos Old Vines Bobal (Manchuela)
description: This Bobal's burnt rubber, black cherry, pencil eraser and soap aromas are ominous. It feels blocky and syrupy, with little flow to the palate other than pasty, candied berry and cassis flavors.

title: Viña Chocalan 2015 Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Maipo Valley)
description: A green nose lacks fruit and instead smells oily and like matches. An O.K. palate feel is helpful, while flavors that hint at passion fruit but are essentially vegetal aren't a plus. On the finish, asparagus and canned bean flavors rise up.
